I also do not like that the auto shoot buttons (such as the portrait, action, nighttime, etc) are now embedded in menus - Yuck! The camera is slightly heavy, but more than easy to hold on to. I wish I could use my lenses from my Cannon EOS 7E on it - maybe they can ... do something about that! The lag time was surprisingly long. I expected a much shorter lag time for the money spent and the time since my last PowerShot camera. Overall, it is a nice camera. It is way to overpriced! My husband bought it for Christmas. I would not have spent that money for the camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Photo and video quality
Cons: Wide range of features can be more complex to learn
The G12 takes much better quality photos than my older G7. The weight is the same, but it comes with much improved features. I also like the rotating screen on the back. It allows much better shooting angles in akward situations, such as wanting to shoot pictures of a child on the floor without getting down on your knees. The G12 is much better at handling shifting light conditions when making digital video clips as you pan across. It is an excellent camera for the advanced amateur / enthusiast. It does have a point and shoot mode, but the G12 is not a point and shoot camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This isn't a point and shoot and this isn't a DSLR. If you are comfortable with both those styles, don't assume you'll jump right into this camera without a learning curve. To shoot RAW, you have to shoot in non-auto modes. I love shooting in manual with my SLRs so I immediately tried to do that. I had a difficult time getting the exposure I wanted both with & without flash at first. The photos (once I got more used to the camera) look FANTASTIC and I'm excited to have RAW shooting capabilities in a smaller camera. I look forward to taking this on my vacation instead of my SLR later this month. I love that you have dials on the outside of camera to control manual functions. The camera is a little bigger/bulkier than I expected. It's not quite a pocket camera, but rather a camera that ... would fit in a backpack, purse, or drawstring bag on a vacation. (fannie-pack anyone?) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This is my carry around everywhere camera for when I don't feel like lugging around the 5dmk2 and accessories. Though not a shirt pocket camera (at least my shirt pockets) it's small enough to fit in a jacket pocket or small bag on my belt. Takes great pictures, I can still shoot in Raw, and I can control most of what I need to quickly without having to search through menus to find everything. All the controls are right up top or on the back. The swivel lcd is bright and clear and is great for taking those low or high shots. So far I haven't found anything I don't like about the camera. Another good feature is you can get a filter adapter made by Canon that works really well with 58mm filters (love my polarizer!) and isn't too expensive.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: For those who want the quality and functionality of an SLR but dont like the size this is an awesome alternative. With the exception of lens, this camera takes care of everything else. The pictures are great quality. The pop out screen is the best feature. This is my vacation camera instead of my 7D.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Cannon G12 is a great vacation camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Quiet; Tilt /Swivel LCD; Good Image Quality; Small and capable; Easy To Use
I have a number of DSLRs that are too big to carry on vacations and trips, and my point and shoot doesnt have any real control. The G12 has reasonable megapixel count, handles well, is big enough but not too big and provides manual control. The viewfinder is great for bright sunlight and the tilting display lets you hold the camera high or low. The quality of the photos is good and depends on your skill and care. I would prefer a bit more control over the auto focus and exposure modes, but it does well enough on its own. I guess I really wanted a $1000 camera for [$]. I bought a belt pack case for it and it goes with me just about everywhere now and my wife took the old point and shoot.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Great little pocket camera. I have a Canon 5D Mark II, but wanted something a little easier to transport in my carry on luggage for business trips. I took it with me on a trip last week, and it worked great. I really like the ability to manually control the shutter/aperture/iso, etc using the dials on the camera versus drilling through menus. The screen is nice and sharp, and the pictures look great. To be honest, it's a little large for pocket camera, but compared to the 5D, it's tiny. I didn't want to trade image quality for size, and this camera gives me the best of both.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I have 3 dSLR cameras (5DmkII, T2i, and XTi), as well as a G9. The G12 can't match my dSLRs, but does come pretty darn close to the XTi, and blows the G9 away! I love the HDR feature (takes 3 exposures and merges them in-camera). 720p video is also a plus (but not necessary). In general, the image quality is excellent for a point-and-shoot. And with a built-in hot-shoe, I can still use it with speedlights and strobes, all with a much faster x-sync speed as well. Again, my preference is to shoot with my 5DmkII or T2i, but when I don't feel like lugging this gear around, the G12 fits the bill well. A purchase I don't regret.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This is my second powershot camera. This model is a big ungrade for my general use. I need and use the water proof case for underwater pics and for rain/wet condition pictures. I have not played with all the bells and whistles, but am most happy with the LCD screen visibility, even with sunglasses and in the case. For the money spent, the pics and videos using the zoom or not are very good quality. I plan on many years with this camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera, but S95 was best for me...
Item.Review:
Pros: Amazing pictures in a smaller than DSLR package.
Cons: S95 is almost same camera in much more reduced size.
I really liked the G12 but returned it. Just too big for what you get. I like the lense but there are better lenses out there in this size range. And I like the pictures but the S95 is almost as good and it's almost 3 times smaller.
Check out the S95 if you get a G12. You will be envious of the small size that fits in a pocket and attracts a lot less attention when taking discrete pictures. I like taking pictures of people at parties and get togethers, and when we are at work even. The S95 is the same camera as the G12, with a smaller lense and a much smaller footprint and it makes a lot more sense for most people.
Unless you are a reporter and usual ... ly want to carry a DSLR but can't in some circumstances I think the S95 makes more sense for 90% of people in average circumstances. I put a small aftermarket handle on the front of my S95 (ala G12 grip) and it really makes the S95 a grabbable package that can be just as nice to use as the G12.
The lense on the s95 is slower than on the G12 but not by much. I have not given up much to have a camera that can walk around with me every day, instead of when I remember to bring it. And I take a lot more pictures now. I never use my phone for video or stills any more; was never really happy with it's lack of zoom or it's speed. With S95, it's never an issue. I can zoom on license plates, or ID things with the digital zoom I can't see with naked eye. That's really a lot of power in or pocket..
DSLR is nice but it will sit around the house most of the time and not get used. Pocket cameras are the wave of the future and the 95 is a great example of low light capabilities and size in a powerful small package. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good Image Stabilization; Large Clear LCD; Good Image Quality; Easy To Use
The Canon G12 is a great general purpose camera. It's been an arms length away from me ever since I got it and I even pack it along with my pro gear when I want to get out and do some serious shooting. I love to use the articulating screen for photographing from unusual angles. The hot-shoe is a big plus and all the essential controls are at you fingertips. Highly recommended!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: We purchased two G12s for a hiking trip in Europe as our 5D Mark IIs would be rather heavy. They are brilliant little cameras with pro controls which feel right at home. We went to [...] to compare the G12 with the S95 and the choice was a no-brainer. While the S95 might be the perfect pocket camera, the G12 feels like the REAL cameras we're used to. The 10mp sensor delivers wonderful photos and video. I've been intrigued with the Canon G-series cameras for years but never bought one until now. Great decision!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This camera is awesome!!! I use it for rock climbing and hiking around Colorado. It's as close to a SLR as you can get but still fit in your pocket. I love the Manual settings, shooting in RAW mode and the exposure settings. The camera is stout, well made and the video is decent.Here's some photos and video from the Canon G12:[@]

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Very easy to use, takes awesome photos
Item.Review: Indoor photographs as well as outdoor turn out wonderful, full of color. The ability to use manual settings is terrific in such a light weight camera. The camera grip feels very comfortable in your hand.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera! I've had lots of fun!
Item.Review: I have owned a compact digital camera for about eight years now and have been looking for something new for a while. There's nothing wrong with my old camera, but I wanted something with more options for controlling the photos I take. I settled on the G12 because it has the features I want, but isn't a SLR, which I don't need at the moment. I use the camera at social gatherings and sporting events. I'm also a teacher and plan on using it with my classroom from time to time. What I like about the camera: -The basic functions make taking decent photos pretty simple. Even in manual mode, you can push a single button to set aperture and shutter speed quickly. I find that you can easily switch between full control and letting the camera do of the work. What's good -I like that the scree ... n is on a pivot and swivel. I can see what I'm taking a picture of a more easily than if were stationary. Also, I can protect the screen when the camera is not in use. -As much as some complain that a viewfinder on a digital camera is redundant, but I like the idea of composing a photo without the need for all the bells and whistles. What's bad -I'm a little old school when it comes to my camera. My first SLR was older than I am and I used it up until just a few years ago. I resisted the automatic camera age because I wanted to do things myself. All of the bells an whistles on this camera can be a little daunting. That being said, I wanted bells and whistles, so this can't be much of a complaint. -It came with a neck strap, but not a wrist strap. I had to purchase a wrist strap separately. All and all, I'm very happy with my new camera and look forward to using it for 1000s of great photos. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I chose this camera for those situations where my Nikon D700 was too cumbersome to lug around. The viewfinder was essential and from reviews I assumed the camera had no major problems. Well, the viewfinder is useless with about 70% coverage that is shifted to the right (image shifted right). The shutter lag is just enough that you can't catch quick expressions. In my work I often photograph people being interviewed, usually during the setup and breaks. With my D700 and even my old Canon 40D I am able to catch pauses between sentences and pretty much the expressions I see. The G12 is always late, with prefocus, manual focus, etc. It is just late enough that you can't catch any quick expression. The same goes for movement. Forget about any decisive moment photography unless the mome ... nt waits for the G12. Unless I am missing something, there is no way to lock the focus in manual when the LCD is closed. Even with the LCD open it is awkward to prefocus and lock focus. The Program mode plus Auto Iso could have been a great feature but it is programed to jack the shutter speed and ISO up and use a large f-stop even in bright daylight. The image quality poor at any but the lowest ISO settings. Noise is substantial at ISO 400. Barrel distortion at 28mm is unacceptable and requires post processing if you want your photos to look at all professional. Of the many disappointments the poor viewfinder and the shutter lag make the camera near useless for anything but snapshots. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I haven't Made any large prints from the files yet so i cannot speak to the IQ per se. I have been using the camera to take many shots i will use as texture layers. If you have used Canon point and shoots before the controls are mostly obvious. I am a Nikon DSLR shooter so if you havent used a canon there may be a little learning curve. My initial impression is as expected this is not a DSLR substitue but for those times when a lot of kit will not work it does the job better than no camera at all. One hassle compared to my S90 is that it will not fit in a pocket unless you have an exceptionally large one or cargo pants.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Yes, I know I can get this camera for seventy dollars less all over the internet as well as at the local big bix stores. But with 6 value pays, it just made it a little easier to capture spectacular pictures. The camera starts up lightning quick, plus the photo quality is 100 x's better than the top of the line Panasonic point & shoot. The trade off is weight, plus this won't fit into my pocket. But the photo's, the photo's! There are a ton of features on this camera and will take some time to master. that's for sure. Expensive for a point and shoot camera, but it's buily like a tank. I am ready (wife too) to take the photography to a new level....(for us anyway).

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Since i have the g10, there wasn't much of a learning curve, but every time i turn this camera on, i go wow. the color is simply outstanding. much better than the g10 in my opinion. i love the swivel screen, the features are fun to play with and use. love the scenes and the HD video is good. i have nothing to compare it to. used it several times and again wow. i bought this over the olympus zx-1 because it had a view finder and the swivel screen (great for hard angles). i'm not retiring my dSLRs, but i am comfortable taking only this camera on vacation and with me every day. oh the battery life is the best i've ever seen in a compact.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Rotating screen, viewfinder, build quailiy, excellent photo quality
Cons: Nothing
I just bought the camera but have taken many many photos in all different settings. Indoor, outdoor, macro, beach, action, with flash, without flash, etc and all I can say is the camera is awesome ! I had a Canon G 9 and when that broke (after taken a zillion photos) I bought a G10 which I thought was awful in picture quality. Even exchanged it thinking the camera might be defective but the second was just as bad. Awful ! I did not touch the G 11 and figured I try the G12 and I am glad I did. I am thrilled with the camera. I am thrilled. The camera has a unique feature set that I knew I wanted. First was the vari angle rotating LCD screen. Great for taken low and high shots that you ... might miss. You position the camera, not yourself and then turn, rotate or flip the screen up or down to you. By being able to also flip it , it is a breeze for taken self portraits as you can see yourself. The camera has a decent zoom but because the lens is so sharp, you take a picture and then enlarge and crop in on the subject in post production without a big loss in picture quality. I was very impressed with the results ! The design and the controls are retro and I love the ease of changing key settings without going in to hidden menus. On the camera are roatating dials that you turn to change settings, like for ISO, etc. I am very happy with the ISO settings as this camera has more to choose from. For example, most cameras have 100 ISO, then 200 ISO, etc This camera has incremental ISO settings, so you can go from 100 ISO to 125 ISO, to 150 ISO, etc .and the way up. The manual settings are great, such as aperture settings, shutter speed, exposure compensation, etc. The next feature I love is the viewfinder. It has a dioptic adjustment to use for your own eyesight so the images are clear, even if you wanted to use it without your glasses on. You turn the dial near the finder until the image is in focus. In bright sunny light and screens get washed out you always have the viewfinder. ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I'm an avid photographer. Overall, I'm very happy with the G12. Nice compact size with a lot of features. Full battery charge lasts a long time. Autofocus sometimes takes a while to focus on the subject. When taking multiple shots with flash it takes time for the flash to recharge before you can take a shot. Zoom quality of the picture taken - too grainy.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I use this camera to document my artwork. I am an installation artist requiring professional standard documentation of my work, and although I am only an amature photographer, I find the shots taken with thus camera to be of a very high standard. I mostly use it on Manual setting, without the flash, and with professional lighting indoors. I love how the LCD screen can swivel, and I can attach a magnifying lens if I want to, a great feature. I've only had a few weeks, so I haven't had much of a chance to fully experience it all yet, but I think the battery may run out a little quick. (or it may not have been on full charge when I got it out of the box?) other than that, great product, nice and light to carry, perfect for travel, excellent quality photos.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Beautiful camera, a super nice upgrade from G2. I feel guilty about spending so much on myself.
Cons: a) Price b) NO manual 9who wants to print out a 200+ page PDF
1)Surprised how small the camera is I thought it would be larger. 2) Newegg packing is disgraceful. A handful of peanuts - No bubble wrap to protect a $500 camera. I have had $50 hard drives wrapped better in bubble wrap. 3) Confusion on which accessories I need, lens bellows,UV lens, lens cap? Not much information available.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: The next best thing to an SLR
Item.Review:
Pros: I had a G6 and then replaced it with a G7 which finally died a months ago. I don't use most of the manual settings (I bought the G6 hoping to learn them but lost interest). I decided to save some money and get a good camera with out all the bells and whistles so I bought a Nikon Coolpix 8100. It didn't even compare. It was slow and took alot of blurry pictures. The detail just wasn't there when you zoomed in on a picture. I want a good camera and use it for family pictures and edit with Photoshop. However most of the time I just have it set to Auto. I RMAed the Nikon and got a G12. This thing is amazing. It is extremely fast at start up and taking shots. I love how it auto selects the picture type (macro, portrait, etc). I know it does a million manual things that I don't ... use but it's worth the price to have it take amazing shots on auto
Cons: It's not small or light. In fact it's bigger and heavier than my G7 was. It's not cheap.
This is about as good as it gets with out a bulky expensive SLR. Considering that it is a great value. I love the flip our screen. (something that went away on the G6). This is an awesome camera that I would reccomend to anyone whether they want to shoot manually or just leave it on auto. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I was looking for an upgrade in a camera but still dreading the weight and price for a DSLR camera with exchangeable lens. Aiming to venture in some manual shots but mostly using the preset preferences. Picture quality, video quality and easy of use are GREAT. Easy to carry. Even fit a large pocket in a coat or jacket. Recommend it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I am not a professional photographer but I am arts professional and I need very good quality images of my work. This camera replaces a whole range of cameras I used to have which were stolen all in one go. I had considered getting a new slr but in the end decided that a very flexible point and shoot would be more my line. I am able to make excellent quality reproductions of my work with the G12, and already am experiencing the benefits of its flexibility and great image quality. My only complaint is that the manuel that comes with the camera is only very simple, covering only the most immediate operation. The rest of the manual is on a disk which one must sit in front of the computer to read. There are many functions on this camera which I probably wont ever use, or which I have to e ... valuate the correct situation in which to use them. But I think this camera is a wonderful solution for someone who has my needs of a camera, great quality, lightweight and with a good intermediate lens. If I want a better zoom or a wider angle I will get into an slr again, but meantime it is great to have a really good camera that I can carry around easily. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: An easy to use point and shoot perfect for beginners but with enough options to get manual crazy if you possess the know how. Brilliant pictures in a small package! Can't say enough about it...Get an extra battery this one is a energy vampire.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Because of this camera's size it is not as intimidating as lugging around a big DSLR with a large lens. The photos you can capture with this camera are amazing!! I read all the comments on this camera before purchase it and was worried if I was really going to be happy due to a few of the negative comments by professional & semi-professional photographers. It's a learning curve, especially if you want to use all the manual settings like I have done. Many times I wanted to put the G12 down and grab my big camera because I knew it was going to be faster for me because the G12 controls were different to me. I love it!! I am happy with the quality of the image and cannot wait to purchase the waterproof housing!! It truly is an amazing small camera but it's going to be different than your l ... arger camera, just give yourself the time to play around with it!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I am currently filming a documentary in Eastern Europe. The film crew have all their prosumer gear but have been amazed at how well the G12 records video. We will be using footage from the G12 for the final edits. We are also writing an editorial for a magazine. The G12 is going to be a solid contributor as the ease of cary means it always on hand to shoot a professional RAW still (or to capture unexpected moving images). The 'miniature' setting on film mode allows for some amazing time laps'. The camera start up is quite quick and shooting in auto allows you to get some good 'from the hip' holiday snaps. This makes the most of the point and shoot genre, that the G12 falls into. It is however a little bulky for streamlining into your pocket. It fits fine in a jacket or sits well on th ... e neck strap tucked into your sweat shirt. In all, this camera has been perfect for traveling with, shooting stills and moving image at a profesional level. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: The camera has a good textured feel, though the controls are a little crowded, the lcd screen is excellent, and the battery life is ok. I do not find it sluggish at all, in fact, it seems very snappy to me. It is capable of taking excellent pictures if you are willing to adjust some settings first. Macro pics with this camera are very good.
Cons: However, for an out of the box point and shoot, I am very dissapointed in the full auto mode. You will need to adjust some things to get good pics in most cases. It wants to raise the iso setting instead of using the flash in indoor settings, which results in a very noisy picture. The camera doesn't have a superfine compression setting like my older canons have. The neck strap is good, but gets in the way a lot in use. Oh, a b ... ig con for me is NO printed manual. You get a little quick start guide in the box and a pdf manual on the cd. To me, that sucks, especially with all the features this camera has. Canon doesn't even sell a paper manual, so forget about having it on you as you learn the camera.
If you switch to the P mode you can still use it like it's in auto mode, but you can change the settings like you want. You need to set the iso change speed to slow, so it will try not to raise the iso setting, and I set the max iso setting to 400. If It would let me I would set it to 200. You can still change the iso speed manually with the dial on the top. I also found the default jpegs a little soft, so I increased the sharpness on mine. I know it sounds like a lot to do, and it is more than I think you should have to do, but after the changes the camera takes excellent pictures, so I will still give it 4 stars. If you plan to leave it on full auto mode, I give it 2 stars. If they fix the auto mode in a firmware update, I would give it 5. Hope this helps. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: great camera at an excellent price
Item.Review:
Pros: Great lcd; Clear Menus; Image Quality; Improved tactile controls
Cons: Viewfinder is only fair
I have had Powershot cameras since the G-4... It is an excellent camera at a very good price. I have a Canon 5D as well, but the size and convenience, and great images I get with the G12, make it my go to camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera I made the right choice
Item.Review: I have a Nikon D90 as my primary camera but I wanted a subcompact to carry with me. I looked at the NikonP7000, but decided afrer reading reviews that the Canon was the camera I wanted. I like the flip out display,the feel of the camera, the HDR feature, easy controls, and all of the DSLR features it has to create quality photos. I made the right decision!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Canon G12- the best of both worlds
Item.Review:
Pros: Video mode-great; Short Lag Time; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Small / Compact; Easy To Use; Good Image Quality; Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization; Large Clear LCD; Fast shooting; Fits the hand
Cons: No time lapse
This camera was a replacement for an old Sony digital. Man, were we surprised at how fast the G12 is, and how easy it is to take video. It's easy to switch between modes, too. It's a point and shoot if you want that, or you can tweak it just as you like. Best of both worlds. Frankly, I'm amazed how long the battery lasts. A friend of mine who is an award winning photog for The Toledo Blade recommended the G12, and I'm very glad I listened to him. We're now using it to take all sorts of pictures we never considered before. Can't wait to take phot ... ography class using the G12.
The G12 is our Christmas present to each other so we used it quite a bit. It's fast enough that I was able to catch many facial expressions of the kids while they opened their presents. The digital cameras I had in the past, were never fast enough to catch that. I'm really impressed at how it works and all for under five hundred dollars! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use. Takes great pictures and video.
Cons: It's larger than most point-and-shoot cameras.
Set this camera on automatic and it takes great pictures every time. It also offers many features found on single-lens reflex cameras. It shoots beautiful HD video as well. I especially like it's ability to shoot pictures in low light conditions.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: If you don't want the expense or inconvenience of a dSLR, the PowerShot G12 is the way to go. I'm admittedly just an amateur photographer, but I've gotten some stunning photos out of this camera. Portraits and macro shots are really easy to get just right. There's some noise at higher ISOs (as to be expected), but really great overall. Plus HD Video, RAW + JPEG, and small enough to carry in my bag at all times.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: I wish I'd bought the G12 years ago!
Item.Review: I finally updated my G-2, and now have the G-12. I love the rotating screen on the G-series, so that was the main criterion for buying another G-series Canon. Of course the G-12 has many more cool and handy features as well. I also like the size of this digital camera; it's larger than the shirt-pocket digitals, but I prefer its substantial feel. I'll be carrying it around with me much more than my full-size DSLR!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Out of the box the camera appears solid, with external controls, RAW capability and so forth. But the shutter lag exceeds a full second, and you have to first half-depress the shutter to focus before taking your shot. If your subject moves in the interim, the focus tracking option is useless. The flash consistently blows out highlights, and most irritating, the so-called spot focus reveals itself as a large blob in the viewfinder, leaving the shooter unsure just where, if anywhere, the camera is focusing. I hope Canon installs SLR-quality focusing points in its next version, and reduces shutter lag that exceeds Canon's own $100 pocket cameras. Images above ISO 200 are rather noisy as well. I returned the camera and will stick with my 5D Mark II and D20 for now. It's more weight, but I can ... trust them. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Best Portable Pro Camera For The Money
Item.Review: I bought this to replace my G9. I was concerned about noise when shooting above 400 ISO. My research led me to believe Canon had addressed it in the G12, so I gave it a try. So far, I have not been disappointed. I like the full manual features of the camera. I typically like to create my own shots, so I need the control. I also like the option to add a flash. I used a Speedlite 420EX with my G9 and now my G12. I like the power and flexability for creative lighting and how the camera can control the output. I really wanted a camera which can control the shot similar to a SLR. This camera is the best for my price range. The image quality seems better than my G9. So far, I don't like how the HDR function only works in auto mode and does not allow the user any input as to how the im ... age is made. I feel the HDR images are a little on the bright side. I took a few test shots and in general like the results. If you take images in the early morning or at night, the image exibits more digital noise. Compared to my G9, the dial in the back seems more flimsy. In all, I feel this is the best camera for the money. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: All I need for most photo work
Item.Review: This is the camera I carry almost everywhere, and that is my style of shooting. I want a camera that has many controlable features as I can get in a pocket camera. This camera though a little larger than most featured point and shoot cameras is the best in class and is more than adequate in most situations. I found the moveable LCD a little ackward at first but have found it very helpful for getting perspective on high or low or around the corner shots.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: G12 Gives the Best of Both Worlds
Item.Review: The G12 is a great camera for serious photographers as well as point-and-shooters. I use it for when I can't or don't want to haul my heavy equipment with me; usually on a longer hike. It's easy to use and takes great shots on auto, but at the same time has all the manual control you could want. Love having the ISO and EV knobs on top. If only they could fit a large sensor in it. Note: Haven't used it much for video yet as that's not my thing, so I can't rate that aspect.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I have a Canon 5d mk II (yeah, it's old now, but it still works...) and the G12 is no comparison. But, it is awesome in one function, it easily fits many functions, pictures (macro and regular) plus video into an easy to bring along everywhere camera. I like how its screen is movable. Really helps in cramped conditions. Wish my full frame had that feature!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I use this camera for family snapshots, trips to museums with my 2 sons, family vacations, and backyard photos. For my pro work I use Canon 5DmkIII and 7D. Now the G12 is excellent little camera, with lots of features from pro line camera bodies. The image quality is acceptable, but the ISO 400 start to show the noise. I understand that this is small sensor camera and that is not a really cons, I just wanted to mention that. I am happy with this product, my neck does not hurt me carrying around, I like that you can silent/mute the audio noise in the cam. The AF is simple and fine. Finally I can ask some stranger to take a photo of my family with me included!!! I choose g12 over G1x because of the AF and size. I needed simply camera with advanced features.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: We owned PowerShot G9. I think that G12 is so much better. By putting a special bottom for over and under exposure it is almost equal to manual exposure control in much simpler way. Canon has put more controls in bottoms instead of menus. It is much quicker to use them when you become use to them. Another example is a second bottom to control speed/exposure. I think it was very wise to lower the megapixels count. The pictures are so much better. I have a Canon 5D Mark II. My wife and I have the G12 to take snapshots of family, mostly flash pictures using the one which is in the camera. G12 makes it possible to take pictures in low light with flash and long exposure so the surroundings can be seen. (It is difficult to do it handheld without a support and the white balance is set on the f ... lash and the lights are usually with warmer colour.) If one can held the camera steady I think is nice. On usually has a lot of pictures of same persons and the most important difference is the different surroundings. My friend is not very keen photographer but wanted to own expensive cameras like the EOS 5D. After my advice he bought G11 and is more satisfied with it than he was with the old EOS 5D. He likes the possibility to take panorama pictures where he can see part of the first picture when he takes the second one. The reason why we bought PhowerShot G9 was the possibility to shoot RAW. The picture from G12 are so much better. It is a camera simple enough for beginners and advanced enough to be a second camera for more advanced photographer or to be a steppingstone towards SLR. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The screen is greeat, I like the exposure dial and ISO dial, don't have to get into the menu to make adjustments. We wanted a camera that still have a view finder, It is just a piece of glass. If you could see the view finder on the back through the eye piece Canon would have a winner. Overall it is better than I expected in shapness, quality and ease of use. Video is ok not as good as my 7D, but for the price this well worth the price

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: For many the search to find the perfect camera that bridges the gap between the heavy but fully functioning DSLR and the easily pocketable lightweight point and shoot will never end. For me, it has with the purchase of this camera. It has it all, it allows the full range of control and thus creativity, its produces stunning images with its solid combo of sensor, glass and software. I found it to be lightning fast, easy to use and most of all it doesn't weigh the 5kgs of my DSLR unit and lenses! I will say though that Canon do need to bolt on a bulb setting to the next edition, though even without it the camera pulls out some great long exposure images. Also, if you decide to invest in a lens converter or filter mount for this camera, be warned, fitting them takes as long as swapping out a ... n SLR lens. For those just starting out in photography or less familiar with cameras don't let all the knobs and buttons on this camera worry you, this unit is great to learn on as it has a huge section of automatic settings and you can learn to do it all manually and expand your range at the same time. I really love this camera, my best purchase of 2010! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The first unit I received had what appeared to be a blotch on the sealed sensor, [...] The replacement works perfectly and I'm enjoying the quality of the images and the depth of the capabilities. The miniature effect is fun and looks like a tilt-shift lens. The HDR effect looks really good, too (the camera takes 3 images at 3 exposures and combines them automatically). Add in the wink self timer, the blink detector, and the smile detection with all the other features and you have a wonderfully small all around camera. It's too bad that you can't use the RAW settings for most of the effects. A great advance from my G10. I can use my Canon external flash on this camera (as with most of the G series). I also appreciate the movable LCD screen for macro photography.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I just ordered and received the G12 two weeks ago. I am in the learning phase. I shoot with a Canon DSLR and also have a pocket Canon Point and Shoot--so fortunately the controls and icons are similar. The only complaint I have at this time is the White Balance. I am still experimenting--but the colors are not accurate. I want to do some comparisons with my other cameras. Otherwise I would have given the camera 5 stars. I purchased the G12 to have a smaller camera to use when I do want to take the larger gear. It has been highly recommended by pros as a back up. I have only played with some of the amazing features. I am looking forward to using the built in options (HDR, fisheye, ND filter, etc.)

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Canon G12: 2011 must (if u dont yet)
Item.Review: My Purpose: all around general camera for daily use (also have 5d mll) exploring northern cali Firstly it just feels great in your hand... you can clearly tell this is no typical point & shoot camera. It has a nice weight & build. Upon placing in the card & testing the settings it works beautifully. I was amazed at how beautifully it captures the light. Then the way that you change the f -stop & aperture was just like that on my DSLR. It was a seamless transition! Additional features that made me choose this one are the RAW shooting mode & HD Video. I am very impressed with the quality & ease of use! My roommate after playing with it also decided that she wanted one to use also. This sure beats carrying around my Flip cam + point & shoot!!! I highly reco ... mmend this product expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Needed a point and shot camera with both a manual mode and RAW. Also wanted to put in a housing to use underwater. This camera serves all those needs. Used for the first time on a trip to Disney---Pictures were of great quality and the video was excellent. I do a lot of photography professionally and own a number of DSLR's. This camera puts out a very good image quality for its size and easy handling.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Traded in a bunch of lenses and DSLR for the new Canon G12. What a great instrument. I do alot of 4 wheel drive on backroads throughout the West. The G12 is compact and always ready for that scenic shot that requires you to jump out and take the photo without falling behind. The variable screen is extremely handy for down low pictures of flowers, insects and wildlife. Held up high, gives the ability to photgraph scenes over the top of bushes rocks etc.. Great camera for outdoor enthusists. Only slightly larger than a typical point and shoot, it is easily carried in a pocket or belt case.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I am a professional photographer with photography always on my mind. An SLR with a couple of lenses was always the best option, but it was sometimes a uncomfortable to carry that much equipment. I found in this camera a the power and features (manual mode specially) of an SLR in a compact design. Pics quality is superb and carrying it is not a problem. I even started using it for candids in weddings.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This Canon G-12 is a great tool for the person who is more than a weekend or occasional shooter. It is a compact very solidly built digital camera which, in my experience, has very good battery life and a very nice accessory case for easy carrying. One change from previous G models is the swiveling screen which allows for getting good shots at child level or above crowds. That screen is adequate in sharpness but it is not in itself a reason to buy/use the G-12. The only negative that I have experienced is that it is a bit heavy for its size.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: First let me state that the 2-star rating is due to the camera's movie capabilities. For the stills, though havent tried all the settings, I am very satisfied. Also find fault with the viewfinder. Here are my reasons: When shooting a movie and using the zoom feature the camera's audio picks up whirring and clicking sounds (from the motor). Also the zoom(while in movie mode) is digital zoom not optical and the user has no control over this. When I noticed this I called Canon and was told that this was 'not acceptable and the camera I had was faulty. So I exchanged for another one.(Thanks B&H!!). The other camera (still a G12) arrived and I exhibited the same noise problem. Called Canon again and after speaking to several reps finally was reffered to page 30 of the users manual.To quote: ... Pressing the zoom lever will zoom in on the subject. However,operation sounds will be recorded and the movie may appear coarse Translation: You'll get whirring and clicking sounds in your audio and the camera records at digital zoom. True I could go in and delete the audio portion of the video but if I had recorded other sounds this would be a daunting task. As for the viewfinder: It does not display any settings but they are displayed in the LCD. Thus if one wants to use the viewfinder and adjust or check settings, one has to constantly move the camera from the viewfinder to the LCD,etc. In effect why bother having a viewfinder? Another gripe I have is Canon not including a printed user manual and their lame excuse about 'green movement.' I guess all the Canon executives carry around an 8x10 manual at a couple pounds. Or perhaps they have memorized it? Shame on you Canon, if you want to save money cut some of the useless 'features.' So, if you can live with the above, I still think it takes great pictures. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: The good… The camera produces very nice images that I have no doubt will allow printing up to 12”x18” at near the quality of my D300. The images at ISO 100 and 200 are very clean, and ISO 400 is completely usable. The lens has a little bit of distortion (mainly at the wide end), but it is very sharp. Also, the zoom range is fairly decent. The camera feels nice in-hand, and has all of the controls readily available.
Cons: The bad… My main gripe has to do with the build quality and the price. The build quality is definitely nice, but it doesn’t feel as nice as what a $500 compact should provide. It really should have an all metal body in this price range (only the front plate is metal). Also, some of the dials feel a bit cheap. The other gripe has to do with the contro ... ls. As you adjust aperture/shutter speed/ISO/etc., the camera feels a bit sluggish to respond. It’s not nearly as fast as my 2 year old Panasonic. It’s also not a speed demon when it comes to focusing. It takes about ½ to 1 sec to focus in good light. It’s not bad, but I was hoping for closer to DSLR-speed for a compact camera in the $500 price range. The battery charge indicator isn’t very useful – it goes from 3 bars to dead in about 5 minutes of actual use. However, this syndrome is pretty common with digital compacts. Lastly, the optical finder is almost useless.
Because of the build quality and the sluggish controls, I’m left just a bit disappointed. If I could return it, I probably would. I would probably be satisfied had I only paid $400 for this camera. Despite this, I will still enjoy the nice images that can be produced using this camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Awesome picture clarity and image quality. Continuous shoot mode is very fast for a point and shoot camera. I like the no slip coating on the camera. Great HD video.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I have a Nikon digital SLR, but the Canon G12 is what I carry in my purse all the time. I had Canon's Powershot 630A and liked that, too, until it finally gave out. I'd been looking at the G12 and promising myself that if I needed to replace the 630A, I'd buy it, but then I talked myself into buying the more compact s100. After a brief period, I traded it in for the G12. The G12 is one of the larger point-and-shoots but that's mainly because it has two features I love: an optical viewfinder and an articulated monitor. For me, there's no contest. It's well worth the larger size. Furthermore, the controls are beautifully placed and easy to use and the pictures are crisp and clear with beautiful color. The one thing I miss (compared to an SLR) is that in Aperture or Shutter priority modes, y ... ou don't see the shutter speed (if you're in Av mode) or the aperture (if you're in Tv mode) that the camera has chosen. I hope Canon can correct that in the next iteration. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good Image Stabilization; Short Lag Time; Easy To Use; Nice Body Color; Good Image Quality; Large Clear LCD; Good in Low Light
I bought this camera for hiking and backpacking trips, where the weight and bulk of my DSLRs is just a bit too much. My main concern in purchasing a compact camera was image quality, as I'm used to shooting with professional gear. I have not been disappointed!
That's not to say that this or any compact camera rivals a full-frame Canon DSLR with an L lens attached to it. But I am as pleased with the image quality as I would be using my old XTi with the kit lens. That's a lot to ask from a camera in this class -- especially considering the XTi's sensor is 7x larger!
Noise handling at high ISOs ... is great, blows other point and shoots out of the water. The Digic 4 processor does a phenomenal job. The manual controls are intuitive and work well. Even the auto modes are useful, and even fun!
Unless you're willing to pay much more for the G1X, you simply aren't going to find better image quality in a compact camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great advanced point and shoot camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Stabilization; Large Clear LCD; Good Image Quality
Good all around point and shoot. Has lots of manual functions and a hot shoe which is very useful.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I was on the fence about what camera I wanted and I tried out the G12. It offers manual control over pretty much everything as advertised and in reviews. It just turned out that I am happier with a simpler PnS with a longer zoom. I think it would be a great camera for someone who really wants to learn the technical aspects of photography. You can use the camera in auto and various scenes if you prefer. If you are familiar with Canons, the operation is familiar. I will say that the viewfinder is pretty useless. I want to say only good things about B&H for their service in shipping the camera and for the return. Everything was timely and I will certainly use them again.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I like the new features (especially the rotating screen and manual setting options) compared to the G7. There is a bit of adjustment to the new settings. I just hope the color selection mechanisms doesn't die after 5 years like in the previous camera. It is used for photos at workshops, travel and with my family. It definitely meets all our needs.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Reviewer: Don Jeraldo de Bosque del Apache
Item.Review: A digital camera to stay with you at any or all times. Whan your DSLR is too big or not appropriate, and you want high quality images, then the G-12 comes into play. The controls, such as exposure compensation, ISO, program mode, shutter speeds and f/stops, are easy to to find and use. Just a great camera for trips and all around use.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The G12 goes everywhere with me. Fits in my purse. I use Auto the most when I simply want to record an event. I take photos of rooms and like the zoom and wide angle. I belong to a photo group and there is a theme for every meeting...such as Flowers, Night scapes, Animal Portraits, Textures from nature/ Faces,/Bridges etc. and so I use quite a few of the features on the camera. Fundamental, is that it also has a view finder. Whats great is the size and the ease and rapidity in making adjustments . I'm always surprised at how fabulous the photos come out!! Whats bad about it is that it fell in the water and without a warranty I had to buy a new one !!!! But thats OK. My fault, not the g12's. Thanks for not discontinuing it too soon. Carol

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I wanted to replace my old Nikon and this product seemed to have the added features that represented an upgrade. I especially like the larger, clearer LCD and the faster cycle time between pictures. The camera is heavier, but contains more power and capability.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: I've always wanted this camera. Love it!
Item.Review: I bought this camera after using a friend's G11 and the G12 has added bonuses! I love that the LCD flips open and around so that you can take pics of yourself and set up to take group pictures on the time. The video is always an added feature.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: great features in a small package
Item.Review: The G12 is great for those occasions when my 7D is too heavy or obtrusive. The menus and functions will be familiar to a canon shooter, so it is a quick learning curve. The G12 shoots raw files, will accept canon flashes, has an optical viewer, an articulating display screen. File output in Raw acceptable. Great camera for street photography.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I purchased a Canon PowerShot G12 after using my daughter's G12 over Christmas. My small digital camera had limited battery left and my daughter's G12 still had a full charge. The camera was very intuitive. I had never seen nor operated it in the past and found it easy to operate, albeit only on auto. The photos I took with my digital vs. the G12 were incomparable. The G12 took much nicer photos. Additionally, the G12 was very quick. I look forward to learning how to operate the G12 off of its manual setting.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Build quality extremely solid, picture quality, colors
Cons: Nothing
I purchased this camera before a trip to Lake Tahoe/Heavenly Ski resort as a step up from a cheap Kodak point and shoot. I am extremely impressed with the quality of the pictures. The colors are absolutely brilliant and the focus is quick and spot on. I am a novice with a good eye for a nice picture but this camera makes me look better than I really am. I have played with the various features for low light and different effects, but the "auto" mode is so intuitive it picks the correct setting for any given situation instantly. Even my wife, who sometimes struggled taking a clearly focused shot with the old Kodak, takes beautiful shots now (no offense, dear). The camera was on sale for $379 when I bough ... t it so the value was excellent. As an added note, I do not believe that I need more than 10mp since I am not blowing up wall sized photographs. Highly recommended. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I got this camera for Christmas for my wife who complained that point and shoots were too slow to respond. It has lived up to her expectations, and we got some great pictures of our grandkids over Christmas. I like the feel of it, and the many modes that it has to offer, making it a lot of fun to control various aspects of shooting pictures. Fully automatic, set scenes, - experiment! My brother, a professional photographer, was impressed. Sharp pictures, nice depth of field, great color, and maybe I'll try using RAW. Like having the eye piece to compose some of the shots. We did occasionally miss some shots in fully auto mode, but putting it into the kids/sports mode took care of that.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Canon G12 - Good performance, Good Value
Item.Review: Great value! Many point and shoot cameras these days offer good picture quality. What I particularly like about the G12 is it's usability. The menus are not too cumbersome. Locking your exposure and focus is quick and easy making the lagtime relatively short for a point and shoot. That#s where I think most cameras of this type fall down, they're just too slow! There are faster point and shoot cameras, the Nikon V1, Sony NEX7 for example, but this one has a pricetag less that half that of the Nikon and about a third that of the Sony. For less than $400 I'd call it a good value with not a lot of trade offs for a point and shoot.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: PowerShot G12 Digital Camera by Canon
Item.Review: I have had a G7 and a G9 and my comments are by way of comparison. The three obvious differences are the flip out back, the construction. and the front wheel. Starting with the front wheel it is a great addition and makes it more like my 5D mark 2. The camera is lighter and doesn't feel quite as robust as previous models. I'm sure it is strong but the quality of the G7 and G9 made them feel as if they would withstand anything you could throw at them. The flip out, twist about screen worries me a bit but hopefully it will stand the test of time. I went away from the Canon compacts for a while as I wanted a pocket camera but couldn't stand not having an optical viewfinder in bright sun. I now have the best of both worlds but without any info in the optical view finder I still have to rely o ... n the LCD screen. Overall I am still very happy with my purchase as it offers the point and shoot snap shot usage as well as the almost SLR creative auto over rides. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: My 6 th Canon G series Camera
Item.Review: Started with g10 ( 3 ) G 11 (2 ) G12 we will see. Shoot a 5d with no video ability. The 1st g10 took my breath away while doing ice boating assessment for a local tv station. It and I went through the ice, card survived #1. Have lost a few off the motorcycle while shooting & driving action in deals gap Nc. Held up well until bounced off highway at 45mph. The shots have made me great money and the adventures they have been through have been well worth the time. I do recommend this for all the quality ad easy of use. In silent mode great for court room drama! No one has paid me to write this!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I needed a small camera to fit in my purse with more control of the shot than the normal small point and shoot. The G12 is great--I can choose the mode I want to shoot in and it's much more versatile than my old Canon point and shoot.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Just got the G12 to use for photo and video. Am very pleased with the camera so far. It takes great photos and the video is pretty good. I've been especially happy with photos and video in black & white mode. It's not as speedy (in terms of number of frames you can shoot per second) as would be nice. The camera has a sturdy construction and a good feel. The user interface is intuitive and easy to navigate. I eventually want to upgrade to the 60D, but for now, the G12 will do the job!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: As an avid recreational photographer, the G12 is great for is combination of compact size and long feature list. For those of us who can not justify the cost or dont want to be burdened with the weight and size of a DSLR this camera is the best. Having used a G9 for a number of years the G12 was familiar in basic layout, but has many really useful new features. The movable rear display and having common adjustments on the control knobs adds extra versitility over the G9. Multiple zone focus and exposure also adds more control over the G9, and the menu items have brief pop up descriptions, reducing the need to refer to the instruction manual even for lesser used features. Overall a great step forward over the G9, which was no slouch in its time.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The G12 is a very good point and shoot for both video and photos. I purchased it for our student newspaper because I wanted the paper to have a camera that took both high quality photos and was easy enough to use for novices. The G12 fit the bill. It has enough manual controls for photogs, but inexperienced people can still pick it up and go. My only complaint is I wish the spot focus was easier to access and use. All of the other manual controls are very easy to use and feel natural in the hand.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Best carry around for great pictures
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: No printed manual (minor)
Had a G11 that I thought was great. So did a friend of mine and out of the blue he offered to buy it for $300.00. Had it for almost three years so I said yes and immediately got the G12. Very happy with it. It goes everywhere I go even when carrying the DSLR. The ;picture quality is still great,, and the new features are fun to play with. I also enjoy the stepped ISO settings and the higher ISO. I shoot RAW 99% of the time so this works well. I only wish it had a printed owners manual. I like to read these in bed and even a notebook computer is awkward. Highly recommend this camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I am a frequent traveler who takes lots of photos. I'm getting older and carrying around my digital SLR and its attachments is tiring. I wanted a small camera with wide angle and zoom capability. The Power Shot G 12 is loaded with important extra features and the photos produced are outstanding.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This a a great compliment to my SLR kit. It takes decent shots whilst not weighing the 5 kgs of my EOS 40D and lenses. The camera was obviously designed by people who use cameras as the controls are intuitive. The low light performance is better than expected and the build quality is in keeping with the price.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: 1st class quality in a small package!
Item.Review: I am a retired pro and was looking for pocket camera that would give high quality results in a pinch. I would like to have a faster and telephoto lens, but none that I tried were up to the quality I needed. (You need to work in raw format.) I am very pleased with the image quality overall. The close-ups and IS are remarkable. I like the body feel, the controls are positive and the viewer is clear and flexible. The quality won't let you down.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: The best camera I have ever owned
Item.Review: So far I've had this camera about 2 and a half weeks and I really love it. I generally like taking up close shots of things but sometimes those things are hard to get to, or up high, and the SUPER amazing zoom on this camera is wonderful. I love the access to the settings on this camera.(I had a Nikon before and you had to go to menu every time you wanted to change a setting)The hand grip and the shape of the camera are very comfortable to use. And, OH, the flip screen! It's quite handy for taking pictures at odd angles and getting to see a clear view of the screen. I like the good quality on the videos too, though I don't use the video very much. There are not many things that i dislike about this camera, but there is a slight lag after taking a picture. But it's truly a blessing to have ... it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Fully featured, brilliant night photos, ability to connect a timer remote for time lapse
Cons: Nothing yet!
I've had it for about 2 months now and I love it. The picture quality is amazing. I'm still learning how to use it properly but I'm getting the hang of it. Great camera for practice if you want to one day buy a larger DSLR. Its fully featured (to my limited knowledge) and has a dial for aperture as well as a rear dial for shutter speed (or vise versa? still learning). Some cameras in this class have one dial and you would have to go into the menu if you wanted to change the other settings. Not this one though. I also like the ability to connect an intervalometer since I am learning how to do time lapse photography. One of the main reasons I got this camera w ... as because I wanted to be able to take nice long exposure night photos. I'm very happy with the results. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Exactly what I was looking for.
Item.Review: I have only owned the camera a couple of weeks. I haven't even had a chance to go over the manual yet. The camera is so user friendly, I haven't really needed to. It takes beautiful point-and-shoot photos right out of the box. You could probably use it like that forever and it would work great for you but in my explorations so far, I've found several useful settings. It has settings for low light, quick shots, portraits, and video, but what I was most intrigued by are the manual capabilities of this camera. Previously, I worked as a photographer's assistant and owned a Canon 5D digital SLR. I have since chosen a different career path and noticed that the 5D was doing a lot of sitting in it's case. It was a wonderful camera but was too bulky and expensive to carry around and use dai ... ly. I bought the Powershot G12 because it is a smaller investment, it's much more compact (especially without all of the flash and lens attachments), and has the ease of use of a point-and-shoot combined with some of the control of a manual SLR. The only thing I don't love is the close arrangement of the buttons on the back, but I'm sure I'll get used to it. So far it is taking great pictures and is exactly what I was looking for. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The camera is excellent for discreet street shooting. The swing out LCD screen makes it possible to point the camera at a subject and you, looking in another direction. The image quality in good light is excellent for this type if of camera, in poor lighting situation you can still get usable decent images at ISO's as high as 1600. As a professional photographer having total manual control of all the variables is the only way to go. Although I must say some of the auto modes produce great results. I'm a Canon user and once again they have produced a excellent product that is built well. The only aspect of the camera that is quite useless is the view finder. But with a camera such as this such small view finders seem a waste anyway.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: A terrific advanced point and shoot
Item.Review: Nice to use when I don't want to take any of my larger DSLR cameras. I like the many features and the quality of the pictures I have taken so far are great. The weight and size of the camera are perfect to handle during a long sight seeing trip.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Travel, work sometimes. Compact and powerful camera. Good display, good quality and very good exposure in automatic mode. Good material construction. Looking through the viewfinder is not as good as a pro camera and to many controls on the right side you risk to touch accidentally. I'd have preferred they had left the CF card instead of SD. There is a short delay when you shoot that can gives you some trouble if you shoot sport. Raw files and manual controls make this compact camera a great product.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Durability
Cons: Seems that price could be lower for a model series thats been around for years.
Small and durable enough to fit in my pocket during a hike while still taking incredible photos at point and shoot speeds.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: For a small camera with plenty of features, a cheat sheet is a great idea. This is packed with reference information - more along the lines of reminder hints. You have to know what and why you are looking for something to truly benefit from this cheat sheet. It will take time to memorize the location of the areas of information - like chapters in a book, rather than using an index or table of contents. Nice touch that the area's are colour coded too - for example: metering, settings, flash etc. And the page is laminated. HOWEVER - would be so much more convenient if it could be folded to the size of the camera for ease of carrying it with you. Let's face it, small camera - won't need a big camera bag. This laminated sheet will not fit into my LowePro bag (the Apex 110 AW) without ... ruining it to fold it again. Or perhaps a booklet format would have been easier to use. I'd been willing to pay twice the price for such! So the size for me personally - will be cumbersome to keep with the camera itself. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Fabulous camera for all experience levels
Item.Review:
When I wanted to upgrade from my pocket-size Canon Powershot for an upcoming trip to Asia, a friend who is a professional photographer recommended the G12. I was a little concerned I was purchasing more camera than I would know what to do with, but it was just the opposite. The auto setting handles just about everything (even without the flash). Daylight, dusk, caves, partying - it took great pictures and videos in every situation. And, there are lots of manual options that I can grow into.
The best part was when I would ask people to snap a picture of my friends and I they would say "is this the G12?" It was a constant reinforcement that I had made a great purchase.
PROs: Auto can handle just about anything, the special features are fun, the upload speed is really fast (with ... a good memory card), and it's a really small size for the quality of photos (no bulky lenses).
CONs: the only thing I can really think of is that the zoom isn't super responsive. When you move the zoom button it takes a moment to start moving. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I purchased this camera for overseas travel where I did not want to tote along a heavy SLR and associated lens'. The camera offers the ability to manipulate settings to customize the shot. It has a solid feel. My primary concern was the ability to take quality photos. I wanted the abilty to shoot RAW if desired.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: My mother loves this camera. It is a great step for those that want near-SLR quality without the complication and price of a serious camera.
Has RAW and some other powerful features that most point-and-shoots don't.
Cons: A little bit slow between photos, but that doesn't really bother her.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I use it for art and travel photography on the go PRO: great size and possibilities. Finally with a swivel screen! Extremely useful 28mm wonderful performance in darkness (for the price) CON: If any cons, it will be the slight slowness. But it had improved dramatically since the G10, which I also used and enjoyed a lot.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I was waiting 5 month for this camera. Didn't want to purchase G11. Superb camera, probably MOST accurate focusing camera out of point n shoot camera's I ever tried. LOVE how well it focuses in LOW light conditions. After I purchased this camera thru BH photo website, my friend challenged me to see how good this camera will perform vs other consumer cameras. So we took several memory cards and went to local [...] to do some test shoots. We only compared G12 with other $400+ camera's. Surprisanly G 12 was leading camera when it came to FocusingSkin tonesLow ISO performancePretty amazing. So amoung consumer camera's it's SUPERB, but it's not as good as DSLR for example 5Dii with 35 mm 1.4 lens. (that's what I use for weddings). So if you want compact camera this ... is it! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Pros: HDR mode, High resolution, Image quality, Live view/moveable LCD, Lots of useful options ... Cons: Expensive custom battery Got this for a once in a lifetime trip. I was not disappointed in any way. We have beautiful pictures of landscapes, historical buildings and architecture, insides of castles, nighttime pictures, etc. There was nothing I tried that I couldn't do. The built-in HDR mode was a big reason I went with the G12. It is everything I hoped for - very cool! It's not the highest megapixel camera out there, but the image quality is amazing. Canon decided to focus on total camera features and quality rather than cram in the highest Mp. It paid off. The "lowly" 10 Mp images are extremely sharp and crisp and clear. However this is an advanced camera with many features. If you w ... ant the most from this camera, take the time to learn them. When I bought the camera I also bought a digital photography book specific to the G12 and spent a couple of weeks before the trip taking hundreds of pictures as I worked through the book. I think this was key to getting the maximum out of this camera. It is a point & shoot with full auto mode, but I rarely used it. With the practice I had if I needed to change settings, it only took a second or two to select settings that gave me amazing pictures. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I use this camera as an alternative to carrying a dslr with all its gear. I am very pleased with the quality of the photos. It is great to have all the option buttons and dials on the surface so one doesn't have to burrow through menus.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G12 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I've been a fan of Canon advanced digitals for a while and finally pulled the trigger on the g-series (G12). It was worth the wait!! These cameras can be used for simple point and shoot if you don't have the time or desire to think much about the mechanics and instead just want to focus on composition. They also have very convenient features for advanced and manual shooting. The focus is very fast and accurate and the menu system is intuitive. The camera is small compared to an SLR but large compared to today's pocket cams. It is sturdy and has a high build quality... should last under rigorous use (metal body, limited use of plastic). The G-series has been around for some time now for a reason: the cameras are excellent!
